statement.tex: \text{Assume that each child born is equally likely}\\ \text{to be a boy or a girl. If a family has two}\\ \text{children, what is the conditional probability}\\ \text{that both are girls given that}\\ \quad(i)\,\text{ the youngest is a girl.}\\ \quad(ii)\,\text{ atleast one is a girl.}

\\ \text{Let }N_G=\text{number of girls in the family},\\ C_1=\text{first child (boy/girl) and }C_2=\text{second}\\ \text{child (boy/girl)}.\\ \text{Given this, }\textbf{do we have to find the}\\ \textbf{following probabilities?}
\\ \textbf{And if atleast one child is a girl}\ldots\\ \ldots\text{then would the probability be as follows?}

reason.tex: \text{With the given definitions, we can define}\\ \text{events as follows}\\ \begin{tabular}{|c|c|} \hline \text{Event} & \text{Notation} \\ \hline \text{Both girls} & N_G = 2 \\ \text{Second child is a girl} & C_2 = girl \\ \text{Atleast one girl} & N_G \geq 1 \\ \hline \end{tabular} \\ \text{Moreover, we have to find the probability}\\ \text{of both being girls given that} \\ \begin{tabular}{|c|c|} \hline \text{Given} & \text{Probability} \\ \hline \text{Second child is a girl} & P(N_G = 2\vert\, C_2=girl) \\ \text{Atleast one girl} & P(N_G = 2\vert\, N_G\geq 1) \\ \hline \end{tabular}
